column4: Any one experienced a HP Proliant DL320G5 having problem with the network?
eth0 just died a few hours ago, reboot wont fix it.
The traffic-counter just keeps growing about 4GB per second...
is the network card still detected?
No traffic going in or out.
Yes it has, it's a DL320G5
There is a chance that eth0 and eth1 physically changed places, please swap the cable and check ^_^
No, it's nothing like that. I did try the other interace aswell.
I get errors from tg3 when rebooting, for exampl.e
Something seems to be very broken :-) I'll move the pbx to another machine for now, and look at this later on.
Well I'm clueless for now.. Since you claim the cards didn't swap ids with each other ^_^
This must be a hardware problem, either from the nic it self or some other part of the hardware.
